title: Soil Amendments
description: Requirements for safe use of biological soil amendments including manure, compost, biosolids, and other non-synthetic amendments, covering treatment processes, waiting periods, testing, and application controls

requirements.text: Are untreated or partly treated animal manure, compost made with animal manure, or other non-synthetic Biological Soil Amendments of Animal Origin (BSAAO) applied to growing areas or fields? If No, go to 2.09.08.
mandatoryStatements: Use of animal manure or BSAAO is documented
Information gathering for compliance assessment
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of soil amendment practices

requirements.text: If untreated or partly treated animal manure or compost made with animal manure is applied to a growing area, is there a minimum of 120 days between application and harvest for crops in contact with the soil (or soil particles) and 90 days for crops not in contact with the soil?
mandatoryStatements: Minimum 120-day interval for crops contacting soil/soil particles
Minimum 90-day interval for crops not contacting soil
Application dates are documented
Harvest dates are documented
Waiting period compliance is verified before harvest
If intervals not met, product is not harvested or alternative mitigation is documented
requirements.verificationExpectations: Pre-harvest verification of waiting period compliance for all manure-amended fields
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Track application dates and calculate harvest eligibility dates, do not harvest before intervals met

requirements.text: If biosolids are used, is there written verification that the biosolids meet prevailing guidelines, governmental or local standards (e.g., EPA Part 503 or equivalent)?
mandatoryStatements: Written verification that biosolids meet regulatory standards
Documentation includes EPA Part 503 or equivalent certification
Biosolids classification is documented (Class A or Class B)
Pathogen reduction and vector attraction reduction are verified
Heavy metal limits are verified to be within standards
Certification or documentation is from biosolids supplier
Records are maintained for each biosolids shipment/application
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Obtain and review documentation before accepting and using biosolids

requirements.text: Where compost is used, is there documentation of the composting process (e.g., time, temperature, turning regime) that demonstrates that the process will eliminate pathogens?
mandatoryStatements: Composting process is documented
Time and temperature parameters are recorded
Turning/aeration regime is documented
Process achieves pathogen reduction (e.g., 55°C for 3 days with turning, or 131°F for 15 days with turning)
Process meets recognized composting standards (US Composting Council, EPA, OMRI, etc.)
Each compost batch has documentation or certificate of process
If purchased compost, supplier provides process documentation
requirements.verificationExpectations: Review composting process documentation before each use/purchase
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monitor composting process parameters if produced on-site, verify supplier documentation if purchased

requirements.text: Where treated animal manure or compost is used, is there documentation demonstrating that the treatment process is sufficient to reduce pathogens?
mandatoryStatements: Treatment process for manure is documented
Process parameters demonstrate pathogen reduction
Treatment meets recognized standards or scientific literature
Treatment records are maintained for each batch
If commercial product, supplier provides treatment documentation
Treatment effectiveness may be verified through testing if required
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monitor treatment process if done on-site, verify supplier documentation if purchased

requirements.text: Where animal manure, compost or other BSAAO is stored on-site, is it stored in a manner that prevents contamination of crops, water sources, and the growing environment?
mandatoryStatements: Manure/compost storage area is located away from growing areas
Storage is located away from water sources
Storage area contains runoff and prevents leaching
Berms or containment systems are in place
Storage piles are covered or managed to prevent contamination
Storage area is clearly marked and access-controlled
Storage does not attract pests or create odor issues affecting production areas
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly inspection of manure/compost storage areas
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of storage conditions, immediate containment if runoff detected

requirements.text: Where animal manure, compost or other BSAAO is applied, are application methods and timing controlled to minimize contamination risk?
mandatoryStatements: Application methods are designed to minimize contamination risk
Application timing considers weather and soil conditions
Amendments are incorporated into soil when possible
Application does not occur immediately before rain or irrigation if appropriate
Application equipment is cleaned between uses if appropriate
Workers handling amendments follow hygiene protocols
Application is documented with date, field, and amount
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Supervise applications, document each application event

requirements.text: Are all soil amendment application records maintained?
mandatoryStatements: All soil amendment applications are recorded
Records include date of application
Records include field or growing area identifier
Records include type and amount of amendment applied
Records include source/supplier of amendment
Records enable traceability from field to harvest
Records are retained for minimum 24 months
Records support calculation of waiting periods
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly audit of soil amendment records for completeness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Record each application immediately, file records systematically

capaInject: If waiting periods not met: do not harvest affected fields until intervals satisfied, conduct risk assessment if urgent harvest needed
If biosolids lack regulatory compliance documentation: do not use biosolids, obtain proper documentation or switch to compliant source
If composting process inadequate: do not use compost, improve composting process to meet standards, verify effectiveness before use
If treated manure lacks documentation: do not use material, obtain treatment documentation or apply untreated waiting periods
If manure/compost storage poses contamination risk: immediate containment measures, relocate storage if necessary within 30 days
If application methods create contamination risk: immediately revise methods, retrain applicators, implement enhanced controls
If application records not maintained: implement record keeping system immediately, reconstruct records where possible
traceabilityInject: Soil amendment application records must be traceable to specific fields, application dates, and amendment sources
Waiting periods must be traceable through application records to harvest dates
Biosolids documentation must be traceable to specific shipments and suppliers
Composting process records must be traceable to specific batches and application fields
